titlestmt.titleproper: The Sidney Rose Collection of Gilbert and Sullivan
Rose (Sidney) Collection of Gilbert and Sullivan
titlestmt.author: Compiled by Thomas R. Crumb

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Wednesday March 27, 2019 at 00:01

did.unittitle: The Sidney Rose Collection of Gilbert and Sullivan
did.abstract: Scores, libretti, and songs by Gilbert and Sullivan; articles, programs posters, parodies, satires, and cartoons relating to Gilbert and Sullivan; and a model theater of the original production of The Mikado

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The Collection is open to researchers by appointment. There are no restricted materials in the collection. Please contact the Special Collections staff to schedule an appointment.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The Sidney Rose Collection of Gilbert and Sullivan was purchased by the Music Library of Yale University from Rose's sister in 1972.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Sidney Rose Collection of Gilbert and Sullivan is the physical property of the Irving S. Gilmore Music Library of Yale University. Copyrights belong to the composers and authors, or their legal heirs and assigns.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: MSS 12, The Sidney Rose Collection of Gilbert and Sullivan in the Irving S. Gilmore Music Library of Yale University.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: In 13 series as follows: I. Piano-vocal scores. II. Libretti. III. Photographs and pictures. IV. Satire, parody, biography, critical commentary, letters, and miscellany. V. Periodicals and souvenir programs. VI. News clippings. VII. Programs. VIII. Piano-vocal arrangements of selections from the operettas. IX. Sheet music. X. Posters and graphics. XI. Bab ballads and orchestral parts. XII. Scrapbook. XIII. Miscellanea.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Collection contains a wide range of materials which include: scores and libretti for the operettas; individual songs with words or music by Gilbert or Sullivan; programs and posters; parodies, satires, and cartoons directed at the operettas and their creators; a model theater of the original production of The Mikado; and a large number of newspaper and periodical articles pertaining to specific productions, revivals, and performers.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The Sidney Rose Collection of Gilbert and Sullivan was collected by Rose for a history of Gilbert and Sullivan production in the United States. Rose never completed this work, though he did write an article entitled "Half a Century of Pinafore," (Musical Digest, June 1928).

odd.head: General
odd.p: [Produced posthumously; principally harmonized and orchestrated by German after Sullivan's death.]
